p.k: Jazzed Out shows that each and every imaginable spot is a suitable location for a jazz session. In this episode, Paris serves as a backdrop to sets by the likes of bassist Avishai Cohen, the Anat Cohen Quartet, who show that jazz is at home everywhere.
p.d: Jazzed Out shows that each and every imaginable spot is a suitable location for a jazz session. Unusual locations, in several of the world's metropoles, provide the setting for brief jazz performances: from garage buildings, multi-storey car parks, street corners, subway trains and parks. The sheer rawness of the metropoles merges with the musical creations of various artists who drop by in search for the perfect 'Urban Stage'. In this episode, Paris serves as a backdrop to sets by the likes of bassist Avishai Cohen, the Anat Cohen Quartet and the Jacques Schwarz-Bart Quintet, who show that jazz is at home everywhere.
